skill.name: skill-forge
skill.description: Advanced skill creation system for Claude Code that combines deep intent analysis, evidence-based prompting principles, and systematic skill engineering. Use when creating new skills or refining existing skills to ensure they are well-structured, follow best practices, and incorporate sophisticated prompt engineering techniques. This skill transforms skill creation from template filling into a strategic design process.

security_audit.summary: Skill Forge is a legitimate skill creation system containing Python validation and packaging utilities. The code performs standard file operations for skill validation and packaging. No network calls, credential access, code execution vulnerabilities, or malicious patterns detected. The two Python scripts (validate_skill.py, package_skill.py) are standard utility scripts for skill structure validation and distribution packaging.

content.value_statement: Creating effective Claude Code skills requires systematic methodology rather than ad-hoc templates. Skill Forge provides a 7-phase process with evidence-based prompting techniques to transform skill requests into strategically designed, production-ready capabilities that follow best practices and deliver consistent results.
actual_capabilities: Explicit agent orchestration for multi-agent workflows
Memory-based coordination between skill creation phases
Progressive disclosure design for optimal skill structure
limitations: Requires Claude Flow integration for full agent orchestration
Process assumes familiarity with Claude Code skill architecture
GraphViz required for process diagram visualization
Python 3.7+ required for validation and packaging scripts

use_cases.title: Build new skills
use_cases.description: Transform abstract skill requests into production-ready capabilities using systematic 7-phase methodology.

use_cases.title: Apply prompting patterns
use_cases.description: Incorporate evidence-based techniques like self-consistency and program-of-thought into skill design.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill creation
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill engineering practices across teams with clear quality gates and validation.

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Skill Forge to create a skill for [purpose]. Follow the 7-phase process starting with intent archaeology. Focus on core functionality first.

prompt_templates.title: Refine existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Skill Forge methodology to refine [existing-skill-name]. Start with intent archaeology to verify alignment, then proceed through validation phases.

prompt_templates.title: Complex multi-agent skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a sophisticated skill using Skill Forge that orchestrates multiple agents. Include structural architecture for agent handoffs and memory coordination.

prompt_templates.title: Enterprise skill with resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a production-ready skill using Skill Forge with full resource development including scripts, references, assets, and GraphViz process diagram.

output_examples.input: Create a skill that helps me analyze GitHub pull requests
output: Core workflow: 7 phases (intent ‚Üí use cases ‚Üí architecture ‚Üí content ‚Üí resources ‚Üí validation ‚Üí review)
Key artifacts: SKILL.md with imperative instructions, validate_skill.py script, pr-analysis-process.dot diagram
Quality gates: Structural validation, functional testing, anti-pattern detection

best_practices: Begin each skill with intent archaeology to understand true user goals before designing solutions
Apply progressive disclosure by keeping metadata minimal, instructions actionable, and detailed references bundled separately
Include self-consistency mechanisms for analytical skills by validating conclusions from multiple perspectives
Validate every phase against success criteria before proceeding to ensure quality throughout the process
anti_patterns: Using passive voice in skill instructions instead of imperative voice that clearly directs action
Creating flat structure without hierarchy instead of progressive disclosure across metadata, instructions, and resources
Omitting concrete examples with real data instead of placeholders that do not guide implementation
Skipping validation phases and deploying skills without structural and functional testing

faq.question: What tools does Skill Forge integrate with?
faq.answer: Skill Forge works with Claude Flow for agent orchestration, memory coordination for phase handoffs, and Python scripts for validation and packaging.

faq.question: How long does skill creation take?
faq.description: Average skill takes 1.5-2.5 hours. Simple skills may take 90 minutes while complex enterprise skills may require 3-4 hours.

faq.question: Can I use Skill Forge with existing skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Apply the diagnostic framework to analyze current performance, identify issues, and use the 7-phase process to refine and improve existing skills.

faq.question: Is my data safe during skill creation?
faq.answer: Skill Forge only accesses specified skill directories. Validation and packaging scripts operate locally with no network calls or external data transmission.

faq.question: Why is my validation failing?
faq.answer: Common causes include missing YAML frontmatter, incorrect file structure, undeclared resource directories, or non-imperative voice in instructions. Check validation report for specifics.

faq.question: How does Skill Forge differ from basic skill templates?
faq.answer: Skill Forge provides strategic design methodology rather than templates. It analyzes intent, applies evidence-based prompting, orchestrates agents, and includes quality gates throughout development.
